messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] missing game pieces
messages.msgSnippet: When we have lost some game pieces we try to come up with alternative pieces. A hershey kiss(which might last the whole or not before its nummied up), anything
messages.messageBody:
When we have lost some game pieces we try to come up with alternative
pieces. A hershey kiss(which might last the whole or not before its nummied
up), anything small. We also have alot of pieces that are spare(also known
as the lost then the found pieces), that my youngest uses as counters to do
math.
Tami


>From: "Dennis/Laurie Brown" <Brownville77@...>
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] missing game pieces
>Date: Thu, 1 Feb 2001 14:05:36 -0800
>
>Try contacting the game makers directly. I've had great luck getting them
>to send me replacement pieces for very minimal costs. Sometimes even for
>free!
>
>BTW, I love the idea of a missing parts/pieces drawer. I'm putting that
>great idea into action right away. Thanks!
>
>FWIW,
>Eiraul
>

messages.subject: missing game pieces
messages.msgSnippet: Try contacting the game makers directly.  I ve had great luck getting them to send me replacement pieces for very minimal costs.  Sometimes even for free! BTW,
messages.messageBody:
Try contacting the game makers directly. I've had great luck getting them
to send me replacement pieces for very minimal costs. Sometimes even for
free!

BTW, I love the idea of a missing parts/pieces drawer. I'm putting that
great idea into action right away. Thanks!

FWIW,
Eiraul
